channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The housing market is no longer a wealth-building engine as home prices continue to slump
item.description: "Now, American housing wealth has actually declined in inflation-adjusted terms over the past year—a notable erosion that reflects the market's new eq...

item.title: Trump Says He Will Sign Executive Order Mandating Voter I.D.
item.description: He also wants to restrict mail-in voting and allow only paper ballots. The Constitution doesn’t give the president explicit authority over election la...

item.title: Suspect in Montana Bar Shooting Faces 4 Murder Charges
item.description: The man is accused of fatally shooting four people in a bar in Anaconda, Mont. He had led the police on an eight-day manhunt that rattled the communit...

item.title: Trump Has Obliterated America’s 30-Year Courtship of India
item.description: India must decide whether go all in with a capricious Trump or hedge its bets through a rapprochement with China.

item.title: A City Reinvented: Paris Is Now Greater Paris
item.description: The periphery of the French capital is more vital than ever, and its creativity and dynamism have blurred old boundaries.

item.title: A City Reinvented: Paris Is Now Greater Paris
item.description: The periphery of the French capital is more vital than ever, and its creativity and dynamism have blurred old boundaries.

item.title: Happiness Is a Big, Ugly Sofa
item.description: Buying a new, adult couch in a space of my own felt monumental.

item.title: Rural America is suffering an economic crisis as crop prices plunge — ‘U.S. soybean farmers cannot survive a prolonged trade dispute’
item.description: "Prices continue to drop and at the same time our farmers are paying significantly more for inputs and equipment."

item.title: Tesla lawyers ask judge to throw out $243 million verdict, saying mention of Elon Musk misled the jury
item.description: Musk had taken a big chance by allowing the case to go to trial at a pivotal moment for his electric car company.

item.title: What would the Fed do in a tie vote? It’s not clear, and the Bank of England had to break a deadlock this month
item.description: There have been three occasions when a vote on the FOMC passed by a one-vote majority, though the last time it occurred was in 1973.

item.title: Buford Pusser, famous Tennessee sheriff who inspired Hollywood in the 1970s, may have killed his wife in 1967, authorities say
item.description: There is enough evidence that if Pusser were alive today, prosecutors would present an indictment to a grand jury, said a Tennessee DA.

item.title: Over 15 Killed in Gaza City, One Day After Israel Ends Daily Pauses for Aid

item.title: Behind Thai Premier’s Dismissal, Unraveling of an Uneasy Alliance

item.title: Protests Grow in Indonesia After Deadly Clash With Police
item.description: Demonstrations opposing housing allowances for Indonesian lawmakers turned into outrage against police brutality after the death of a motorcycle taxi ...

item.title: Xi Uses Summit, Parade and History to Flaunt China’s Global Pull
